item.description:
www.nhdfl.org/library/pdf/rhody.pdf

Please join us for an easy 3 mile round-trip hike to the summit of Little Monadnock Mountain, in mid-July when the 15 foot tall giant rhododendron's pink and white blossoms are in bloom.  We will be following 3 hiking trails:  Little Monadnock Trail, the Wildflower trail (which has wildflowers planted near the trail), and the Rhododendron Loop Trail.  Visitors exploring the trails are often serenaded by song birds which live in the grove.The rhododendron grove, which is the largest in northern New England, was designated a National Natural Landmark in 1982.

 www.nhstateparks.org/explore/state-parks/rhododendron-state-park.aspx

We will hike Monadnock Mountain on another day.  Monadnock Mountain is the second-most climbed mountain in the world, after Mount Fuji.  Monadnock Mountain is a more challenging hike than Little Monadnock.

Users assume all risk while recreating in State Park lands.

RHODODENDRON STATE PARK:  This 2,723-acre park located in southwestern NH is named after its focal point, a 16-acre grove of giant rhododendron. A universally accessible trail encircles the grove allowing visitors to observe the plants close up.
item.how_to_find_us: Route 202 to Route 119 west to Rhododendron Road West: End at Little Monadnock Mountain, Phone: 603-532-8862

group.name: Trailblazers- A Seacoast Singles Meetup Group

item.name: Hike Little Monadnock/Rhododendron State Park: 15 ft tall Rhododendrons in bloom
